verbose_text: In both cases, Ananthakrishnan et al [XREF_BIBR] and Gajendran et al [XREF_BIBR], malnutrition was diagnosed by the ICD-9-CM (International Classification of Diseases), which used serum levels of albumin (< 3.4) as indicators; involuntary weight loss of 5% in 3-6 mo and 10% in 6-12 mo; BMI < 18.5 kg/m2 associated with comorbidity, poor diet, and loss of muscle mass [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR].
evidence: albumin (< 3.4) as indicators; involuntary weight loss of 5% in 3-6 mo and 10% in 6-12 mo
